title: Social Problem-Solving Project Through the Lens of Engineering Mechanics

context.prior_knowledge: Expert-level knowledge and experience in solving complex problems
context.additional_context: A blended learning environment feasible in smartphone-based limited-technology settings, focusing on projects that solve real-world social issues using engineering mechanics principles.

learning_goals: Learners will be able to analyze five or more social problems arising in daily life using principles of engineering mechanics

Learners design three or more simple experiments to analyze social phenomena, collect data from over 50 samples using smartphone apps (e.g., Google Forms, SurveyMonkey), and organize the data in Excel to calculate basic statistics (mean, standard deviation).
Learners will be able to present creative design solutions for problem-solving based on mechanical analysis results
Learners will be able to complete team projects with four or more members using online collaboration tools

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
